losers are than who the winners are um
the losers are ones speaking of media
specifically are dependent upon an
advertising model and a pure
subscription model where people are
simply paying for the media
content and that is a very difficult
model as we transition increasingly
rapidly from print you know over the air
to online because that's no great uh

prepared to pay as much for online so
what you and we look at it you need to

I think you know content believe
continues to be absolutely
critical um and people are willing to

like this the notion of just pure

the Distributors the networks themselves
will en enjoy enormous power uh but

very optimistic about where we're we're
headed historically um most companies
have had a point of view that they
needed to create everything on their own
they needed to build it on their own and
uh I think that model is essentially
breaking down instead people need to
recognize what they're good at what
their core competencies are and assume
hopefully that there is a core of that
that is powerful enough to sustain a
business model and that fundamentally
rely on others who can have the scale or
The Leverage to do it more cheaply and
maybe more efficiently look at
newspapers for example why is it that
many newspapers actually even produce a
business section if you go to say the
Chicago Tribune we actually have more
reporters in Chicago than the Chicago
Tribune does why do they need to produce
their own business section now you can
apply that across a lot of different

their business it's the same thing in
the financial services
sector uh many of our customers have
built up enormous infrastructures to
distribute
data uh to manage the uh flow of data to

are not necessarily in every case the
best party to actually do that where the
function is not creating a competitive
Advantage for them so we're having
conversations with a lot of companies
about even creating industry type
utilities that then could be
customizable for that small percentage
of the function that actually creates
competitive advantage uh and those are
conversations that we're having that we
couldn't have had a couple of years ago
so I I think this recognition that you
can't do everything that in fact you
focus on what you're really great at and
are able and willing to in effect
partner or Outsource with others to
bring those skills in house that don't
provide the competitive Advantage you
need but you still are very essential to
the way you do your job your business I

both on the media side and on the
